scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint

appium.serverDefaults.allowCors.description: Whether the Appium server should allow web browser connections from any host

appium.serverDefaults.allowInsecure.markdownDescription: Set which insecure features are allowed to run in this server's sessions. Features are defined on a driver level; see driver documentation for more details. Note that features defined via `#appium.serverDefaults.deny-insecure#` will be disabled, even if also listed here.
appium.serverDefaults.allowInsecure._description: Set which insecure features are allowed to run in this server's sessions. Features are defined on a driver level; see documentation for more details. Note that features defined via "deny-insecure" will be disabled, even if also listed here. If string, a path to a text file containing policy or a comma-delimited list.

appium.serverDefaults.basePath.description: Base path to use as the prefix for all webdriver routes running on the server

appium.serverDefaults.debugLogSpacing.description: Add exaggerated spacing in logs to help with visual inspection

appium.serverDefaults.defaultCapabilitie.description: Set the default desired capabilities, which will be set on each session unless overridden by received capabilities. If a string, a path to a JSON file containing the capabilities, or raw JSON.

appium.serverDefaults.denyInsecure.markdownDescription: Set which insecure features are not allowed to run in this server's sessions. Features are defined on a driver level; see driver documentation for more details. Features listed here will not be enabled even if also listed in `#appium.serverDefaults.allow-insecure#`, and even if `#appium.serverDefaults.relaxed-security#` is enabled.
appium.serverDefaults.denyInsecure._description: Set which insecure features are not allowed to run in this server's sessions. Features are defined on a driver level; see documentation for more details. Features listed here will not be enabled even if also listed in "allow-insecure", and even if "relaxed-security" is enabled. If string, a path to a text file containing policy or a comma-delimited list.

appium.serverDefaults.drivers.description: A list of drivers to activate. By default, all installed drivers will be activated.  If a string, must be valid JSON

appium.serverDefaults.keepAliveTimeout.description: Number of seconds the Appium server should apply as both the keep-alive timeout and the connection timeout for all requests. A value of 0 disables the timeout.

appium.serverDefaults.logFile.description: Also send log output to this file

appium.serverDefaults.logFilters.description: One or more log filtering rules

appium.serverDefaults.logNoColors.description: Do not use color in console output

appium.serverDefaults.longStacktrace.description: Add long stack traces to log entries. Recommended for debugging only.

appium.serverDefaults.noPermsCheck.description: Do not check that needed files are readable and/or writable

appium.serverDefaults.nodeconfig.description: Path to configuration JSON file to register Appium as a node with Selenium Grid 3; otherwise the configuration itself

appium.serverDefaults.plugins.markdownDescription: A list of plugins to activate.
appium.serverDefaults.plugins._description: A list of plugins to activate. To activate all plugins, use the single string "all". If a string, can otherwise be valid JSON.

appium.serverDefaults.relaxedSecurity.description: Disable additional security checks, so it is possible to use some advanced features, provided by drivers supporting this option. Only enable it if all the clients are in the trusted network and it's not the case if a client could potentially break out of the session sandbox. Specific features can be overridden by using "deny-insecure"

appium.serverDefaults.strictCaps.description: Cause sessions to fail if desired caps are sent in that Appium does not recognize as valid for the selected device

appium.serverDefaults.tmp.markdownDescription: Absolute path to directory Appium can use to manage temp files. Defaults to `C:\Windows\Temp` on Windows and `/tmp` otherwise.
appium.serverDefaults.tmp._description: Absolute path to directory Appium can use to manage temp files. Defaults to C:\Windows\Temp on Windows and /tmp otherwise.

appium.serverDefaults.traceDir.description: Absolute path to directory Appium can use to save iOS instrument traces; defaults to <tmp>/appium-instruments

appium.serverDefaults.webhook.description: Also send log output to this http listener

appium.driver.description: Driver-specific configuration. Keys should correspond to driver package names

appium.plugin.description: Plugin-specific configuration. Keys should correspond to plugin package names

appium.serverDefaults.configFile.markdownDescription: Explicit path to Appium config file

appium.serverDefaults.useBundledAppium.markdownDescription: Use bundled Appium. If `false`, look for a locally installed Appium or a globally installed Appium
appium.serverDefaults.useBundledAppium._description: Use bundled Appium. If "false", look for a locally installed Appium or a globally installed Appium

appium.serverDefaults.executablePath.markdownDescription: Explicit path to Appium executable. If left blank, the extension will search for one or fall back to the bundled Appium.  Overrides `#appium.serverDefaults.useBundledAppium#`
appium.serverDefaults.executablePath._description: Explicit path to Appium executable. If left blank, the extension will search for one or fall back to the bundled Appium.  Overrides "appium.serverDefaults.useBundledAppium"

appium.sessionDefaults.remoteAppiumVersi.markdownDescription: Version of Appium server. Ignored when using bundled Appium.

appium.sessionDefaults.protocol.markdownDescription: Protocol to use when attaching to an Appium server

appium.sessionDefaults.pathname.markdownDescription: Override base pathname of Appium server; defaults to path depending on value of `#appium.sessionDefaults.remoteAppiumVersion#`
appium.sessionDefaults.pathname._description: Override base pathname of Appium server; defaults to path depending on value of "remoteAppiumVersion"

appium.sessionDefaults.refresh.markdownDescription: Interval at which to poll known servers for status (in milliseconds)

Note that features defined via `#appium.serverDefaults.deny-insecure#` will be disabled, even if also listed here.

tmp._description: Absolute path to directory Appium can use to manage temp files. Defaults to C:\Windows\Temp on Windows and /tmp otherwise.
